pullRequest.body:
---

Commits can be reviewed individually: the second commit is fully automatic (using VS Code's search-and-replace, in regex mode); the last commit fixes the line length (updating the syntax of that comment to Lean 4).

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
> You're allowed to argue I'm scope-creeping your PR :)

You are, but that need not be a problem :-) If you test and suggest a change, I'm happy to accept it - I am less willing to do this legwork myself. To this end, I have just accepted all of your suggestions, except for one which needs checking.

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the review; I followed your suggestion.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

You're allowed to argue I'm scope-creeping your PR :)

Thanks!

bors d+
You're allowed to argue I'm scope-creeping your PR :)
Good catch on all of them, thanks!

Thanks!

bors d+

But I'm confident that the comma no longer works
```suggestion
  simp; ring
```
Oh, indeed!
I'm not even sure the over-parenthesized syntax works in lean 4

Trying on the playground: [This syntax parses](https://live.lean-lang.org/#code=import%20Mathlib%0A%0Aopen%20Real%0A%0Aexample%20(x%20%3A%20%E2%84%9D)%20%3A%20deriv%20(fun%20x%20%E2%86%A6%20cos%20(sin%20x)%20*%20exp%20x)%20x%20%3D%20(cos%20(sin%20x)%20-%20sin%20(sin%20x)%20*%20cos%20x)%20*%20exp%20x%20%3A%3D%20by%0A%20%20simp%3B%20ring%0A%0Aexample%20(x%20%3A%20%E2%84%9D)%20%3A%20deriv%20(fun%20x%20%E2%86%A6%20cos%20(sin%20x)%20*%20exp%20x)%20x%20%3D%0A%20%20%20%20(cos%20(sin%20x)%20-%20sin%20(sin%20x)%20*%20cos%20x)%20*%20exp%20x%20%3A%3D%20by%0A%20%20simp%3B%20ring), without the spaces it does not. It seems the example fails, though...

```suggestion
    encard_diff_add_encard_inter]
```

```suggestion
    x*y = -2*y + 1 := by
```

```suggestion
    (h1 : ∀ a b : ℕ, a - 1 ≤ b ↔ a ≤ b + 1)
    (h2 : ∀ a b : ℕ, a ≤ b ↔ ∀ c, c < a → c < b) :
```

```suggestion
    (∀ b, a - 1 ≤ b) = ∀ b c : ℕ, c < a → c < b + 1 := by
```

```suggestion
  simp_rw [Nat.add_comm a b] at h; exact h
```
and below

```suggestion
    (e₁.trans e₂).symm x = z := by
```

```suggestion
  simp_rw [Nat.add_comm a b] at h₁ h₂; exact h₁ h₂

```suggestion
  simp_rw [Nat.add_comm a b] at *; exact h₁ h₂
Those can be in the same line as the example, right?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - style: fix some mis-placed by

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: fix formatting of many misplaced "by"s
